item.title: Byapon - Bengali Youth Science Magazine Platform
item.author: abdulohab059@gmail.com (Abdul Wahab)
item.description: Byapon is one of Bangladesh’s most beloved youth science magazines, and I had the incredible honor of developing their digital platform. This project wasn’t just a development task for me — it was a passion project. Being able to contribute to a platform that nurtures young scientific minds in Bangladesh felt deeply meaningful. I learned so much while building this project, and it’s an experience I will carry with me for the rest of my life.

item.title: About Me
item.author: abdulohab059@gmail.com (Abdul Wahab)
item.description: I am Md. Abdul Ohab Sarker, a Software Engineer with a background in Computer Science and Engineering, specializing in Laravel-based full-stack web development. I have hands-on experience delivering production-ready applications, handling deployment workflows, and managing server environments. Beyond development, I actively participate in programming contests and contribute to science education through articles published in Byapon Youth Science Magazine. I focus on building reliable, scalable solutions while continuously refining my technical expertise.

item.title: Summernote Integration with Laravel Blade
item.author: abdulohab059@gmail.com (Abdul Wahab)
item.description:
Summernote is a powerful, free, and lightweight WYSIWYG editor that works exceptionally well for rich text editing in modern web applications. It is especially popular in Laravel-based projects due to its simplicity, flexibility, and ease of integration.

However, integrating Summernote into a Laravel Blade boilerplate can become a bit challenging—particularly when you want to set it up without relying on a CDN. In a local or production-grade setup, you need to manually manage all required CSS and JavaScript dependencies, which adds extra configuration overhead. Since Summernote is tightly coupled with Bootstrap, ensuring proper loading order and compatibility becomes crucial.
